concept.title: Using Alliant Data
concept.shortdesc: Alliant is a leading aggregator of direct-to-consumer purchasing information from online and offline marketers. Adobe Marketing Cloud users can segment site visitors using 65 predictive marketing performance dimensions.

conbody.p: Alliant offers predictive segmentation solutions that enable direct-to-consumer marketers to achieve higher profitability across all of their campaign channels, including traditional mail, DRTV and digital marketing. Alliant’s proprietary cooperative databases include over 130 million consumer profiles packed with rich, behavioral, transaction-level customer data contributed monthly by many of the world’s leading direct response marketers. Alliant uses its proprietary data to deliver insight for marketing decisions, developing powerful multi-channel solutions that let marketers identify profitable new customers, increase response rates and average order size, minimize payment risk, and increase the success of customer retention and reactivation efforts. For more information, visit www.alliantdata.com.

Use the Alliant data to define unique audience segments with behavioral characteristics that might benefit from an alternative experience on your website. Early testing has shown the Alliant segments to be predictive at critical stages of the online conversion process:

ul.li:
Site Engagement
Identify hero imagery and offers that grab the attention of specific consumer segments.
Provide alternative navigation and links that are relevant to the segment.

Conversion and Offer Management
Provide relevant messaging and payment options to qualified segments.
Create targeted upsell offers that increase initial order size.

Post-Engagement Messaging
Use Alliant segments to select appropriate follow-up offers.
Identify alternate channels for conversion, for example email, direct mail, telemarketing, and so on.

section.title: How Data is Derived
section.p: Alliant’s proprietary cooperative databases include over 130 million consumer profiles packed with rich, behavioral, transaction-level customer data updated monthly by many of the world’s leading direct response marketers. The data represents active buyers in over 280 lines of direct-to-consumer offers and contains transaction-level information on new orders, product types and billing transactions. The Alliant attributes are calculated from a transactional database covering 135+ million consumers who have purchased products directly from marketers utilizing online and offline channels. The Alliant Data and the Census data are compiled differently.

ul.li: Alliant scores each zip code in the US based on observations of that variable in the Alliant database.
Each zip code is ranked from "highest" (most prevalence of that attribute) to "lowest" (least prevalence of that attribute).

The score groups are derived from the count of US census households within each zip code. Alliant delivers the rankings in 20 buckets (5% of US households in each bucket) and Adobe rolls those buckets up into five equal groups. Thus, each score group comprises 20% of total US households.

For this reason, zip codes counts are not particularly relevant for analysis. In more sparsely populated areas, the differences in performance are more pronounced. Conversely, large zip codes will tend more to the mean for a given behavior, thus falling to the middle. Thus, the ends of the scale tend to have more (and less populated) zip codes, but an equal number of households.
Each attribute will have different clusters of zip codes.
Demographic attributes are derived from US Census data.
Each zip code contains the numeric value of the given attribute.

section.title: Data Categories
section.p: Alliant provides data in the following categories:
Recency: Drive response with recency. Segments represent prevalence of most recent purchasing activities within the past 30 day, 60 day or 90 day period.
Product Categories: Increase conversion by segmenting people with purchasing history in specific product categories.
Direct Marketing Flags: Identify top direct response segments for purchasing and payment.
Product Types: Identify segments with affinity for specific product types and offers, such as magazines, books, merchandise, entertainment, club/continuity, and replenishment goods.
Purchasing Channel: Identify segments with history of responding to offers by direct mail, telemarketing, and email or internet.

Payment: Identify zip codes with a higher propensity to make full payments for products and continue paying credit card payment plans. Cash and check flags offer insight for alternative payment offers.
Transactions: Provide additional insight into comparative purchase, payment, and returns activity.
Demographics: Profile key lifestyle attributes such as family composition, white collar/blue collar, home value, and so on.

section.title: Ranking Concepts
section.p: You should understand the following ranking concepts:

ul.li: Each zip code is ranked for the relative prevalence of each behavioral variable
Groups of zip codes are ranked from "Very High" (most prevalent) to "Very Low" (least prevalent) with three intermediary levels.
All attributes except the demographic attributes are ranked from "Very High" (most prevalent) to "Very Low" (least prevalent) with three intermediary levels.
Each grouping represents approximately 20% of the zip codes in the country

section.title: How Demographics Attributes are Ranked
section.p: Demographic attributes are derived from US Census data. Each zip code contains the numeric value of the given attribute. These numeric values are available for targeting and segmentation. Logical operators including equals, greater than, less than, and more can be used to group people across zip codes that share the same demographic attributes.
